00015 /** \defgroup imgclass imImage 
00016  *
00017  * \par
00018  *  Base definitions and functions for image representation. \n
00019  * Only the image processing operations depends on these definitions, 
00020  * Image Storage and Image Capture are completely independent.
00021  * \par
00022  * You can also initialize a structure with your own memory buffer, see \ref imImageInit.
00023  * To release the structure without releasing the buffer, 
00024  * set "data[0]" to NULL before calling imImageDestroy.
00025  * \par
00026  * See \ref im_image.h
00027  * \ingroup imagerep */
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031 /** \brief Image Representation Structure
00032  *
00033  * \par
00034  * An image representation than supports all the color spaces, 
00035  * but planes are always unpacked and the orientation is always bottom up.
00036  * \ingroup imgclass */
00037 typedef struct _imImage
00038 {
00039   /* main parameters */
00040   int width;          /**< Number of columns. image:Width() -> width: number [in Lua 5]. */
00041   int height;         /**< Number of lines. image:Height() -> height: number [in Lua 5]. */
00042   int color_space;    /**< Color space descriptor. See also \ref imColorSpace. image:ColorSpace() -> color_space: number [in Lua 5]. */
00043   int data_type;      /**< Data type descriptor. See also \ref imDataType. image:DataType() -> data_type: number [in Lua 5]. */
00044   int has_alpha;      /**< Indicates that there is an extra channel with alpha. image:HasAlpha() -> has_alpha: boolean [in Lua 5]. \n
00045                            It will not affect the secondary parameters, i.e. the number of planes will be in fact depth+1. \n
00046                            It is always 0 unless imImageAddAlpha is called. Alpha is automatically added in image loading functions. */
00047 
00048   /* secondary parameters */
00049   int depth;          /**< Number of planes                      (ColorSpaceDepth)   image:Depth() -> depth: number [in Lua 5].       */
00050   int line_size;      /**< Number of bytes per line in one plane (width * DataTypeSize)    */
00051   int plane_size;     /**< Number of bytes per plane.            (line_size * height)      */
00052   int size;           /**< Number of bytes occupied by the image (plane_size * depth)      */
00053   int count;          /**< Number of pixels per plane            (width * height)          */
00054 
00055   /* image data */
00056   void** data;        /**< Image data organized as a 2D matrix with several planes.   \n
00057                            But plane 0 is also a pointer to the full data.            \n
00058                            The remaining planes are: data[i] = data[0] + i*plane_size \n
00059                            In Lua, data indexing is possible using: image[plane][row][column] */
00060 
00061   /* image attributes */
00062   long *palette;      /**< Color palette. image:GetPalette() -> palette: imPalette [in Lua 5]. \n
00063                            Used only when depth=1. Otherwise is NULL. */
00064   int palette_count;  /**< The palette is always 256 colors allocated, but can have less colors used. */
00065 
00066   void* attrib_table; /**< in fact is an imAttribTable, but we hide this here */
00067 } imImage;
00068 
00069 
00070 /** Creates a new image.
00071  * See also \ref imDataType and \ref imColorSpace. Image data is cleared as \ref imImageClear. \n
00072  * In Lua the IM image metatable name is "imImage".
00073  * When converted to a string will return "imImage(%p) [width=%d,height=%d,color_space=%s,data_type=%s,depth=%d]" where %p is replaced by the userdata address,
00074  * and other values are replaced by the respective attributes.
00075  * If the image is already destroyed by im.ImageDestroy, then it will return also the suffix "-destroyed".
00076  *
00077  * \verbatim im.ImageCreate(width: number, height: number, color_space: number, data_type: number) -> image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00078  * \ingroup imgclass */
00079 imImage* imImageCreate(int width, int height, int color_space, int data_type);
00080 
00081 /** Initializes the image structure but does not allocates image data.
00082  * See also \ref imDataType and \ref imColorSpace. 
00083  * The only addtional flag thar color_mode can has here is IM_ALPHA.
00084  * To release the image structure without releasing the buffer, 
00085  * set "data[0]" to NULL before calling imImageDestroy.
00086  * \ingroup imgclass */
00087 imImage* imImageInit(int width, int height, int color_mode, int data_type, void* data_buffer, long* palette, int palette_count);
00088 
00089 /** Creates a new image based on an existing one. \n
00090  * If the addicional parameters are -1, the given image parameters are used. \n
00091  * The image atributes always are copied. HasAlpha is copied.
00092  * See also \ref imDataType and \ref imColorSpace.
00093  *
00094  * \verbatim im.ImageCreateBased(image: imImage, [width: number], [height: number], [color_space: number], [data_type: number]) -> image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00095  * The addicional parameters in Lua can be nil, 
00096  * and they can also be functions with the based image as a parameter to return the respective value.
00097  * \ingroup imgclass */
00098 imImage* imImageCreateBased(const imImage* image, int width, int height, int color_space, int data_type);
00099 
00100 /** Destroys the image and frees the memory used.
00101  * image data is destroyed only if its data[0] is not NULL. \n
00102  * In Lua if this function is not called, the image is destroyed by the garbage collector.
00103  *
00104  * \verbatim im.ImageDestroy(image: imImage) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00105  * \verbatim image:Destroy() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00106  * \ingroup imgclass */
00107 void imImageDestroy(imImage* image);
00108 
00109 /** Adds an alpha channel plane and sets its value to 0 (transparent).
00110  *
00111  * \verbatim image:AddAlpha() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00112  * \ingroup imgclass */
00113 void imImageAddAlpha(imImage* image);
00114 
00115 /** Sets the alpha channel plane to a constant.
00116  *
00117  * \verbatim image:SetAlpha() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00118  * \ingroup imgclass */
00119 void imImageSetAlpha(imImage* image, float alpha);
00120 
00121 /** Removes the alpha channel plane if any.
00122  *
00123  * \verbatim image:RemoveAlpha() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00124  * \ingroup imgclass */
00125 void imImageRemoveAlpha(imImage* image);
00126 
00127 /** Changes the buffer size. Reallocate internal buffers if the new size is larger than the original.
00128  *
00129  * \verbatim image:Reshape(width: number, height: number) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00130  * \ingroup imgclass */
00131 void imImageReshape(imImage* image, int width, int height);
00132 
00133 /** Copy image data and attributes from one image to another. \n
00134  * Images must have the same size and type.
00135  *
00136  * \verbatim image:Copy(dst_image: imImage) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00137  * \ingroup imgclass */
00138 void imImageCopy(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image);
00139 
00140 /** Copy image data only fom one image to another. \n
00141  * Images must have the same size and type.
00142  *
00143  * \verbatim image:CopyData(dst_image: imImage) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00144  * \ingroup imgclass */
00145 void imImageCopyData(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image);
00146 
00147 /** Copies the image attributes from src to dst.
00148  * Includes the pallete if defined in both images.
00149  *
00150  * \verbatim image:CopyAttributes(dst_image: imImage) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00151  * \ingroup imgclass */
00152 void imImageCopyAttributes(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image);
00153 
00154 /** Merges the image attributes from src to dst. \n
00155  * Attributes that exist in dst are not replaced. 
00156  * Doens NOT include the pallete.
00157  *
00158  * \verbatim image:MergeAttributes(dst_image: imImage) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00159  * \ingroup imgclass */
00160 void imImageMergeAttributes(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image);
00161 
00162 /** Copy one image plane fom one image to another. \n
00163  * Images must have the same size and type.
00164  *
00165  * \verbatim image:CopyPlane(src_plane: number, dst_image: imImage, dst_plane: number) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00166  * \ingroup imgclass */
00167 void imImageCopyPlane(const imImage* src_image, int src_plane, imImage* dst_image, int dst_plane);
00168 
00169 /** Creates a copy of the image.
00170  *
00171  * \verbatim image:Duplicate() -> new_image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00172  * \ingroup imgclass */
00173 imImage* imImageDuplicate(const imImage* image);
00174 
00175 /** Creates a clone of the image. i.e. same attributes but ignore contents.
00176  *
00177  * \verbatim image:Clone() -> new_image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00178  * \ingroup imgclass */
00179 imImage* imImageClone(const imImage* image);
00180 
00181 /** Changes an extended attribute. \n
00182  * The data will be internally duplicated. \n
00183  * If data is NULL and count==0 the attribute is removed. \n
00184  * If count is -1 and data_type is IM_BYTE then data is zero terminated.
00185  * See also \ref imDataType.
00186  *
00187  * \verbatim image:SetAttribute(attrib: string, data_type: number, data: table of numbers or string) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00188  * If data_type is IM_BYTE, as_string can be used as data.
00189  * \ingroup imgclass */
00190 void imImageSetAttribute(const imImage* image, const char* attrib, int data_type, int count, const void* data);
00191 
00192 /** Returns an extended attribute. \n
00193  * Returns NULL if not found.
00194  * See also \ref imDataType.
00195  *
00196  * \verbatim image:GetAttribute(attrib: string, [as_string: boolean]) -> data: table of numbers or string, data_type: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00197  * If data_type is IM_BYTE, as_string can be used to return a string instead of a table.
00198  * \ingroup imgclass */
00199 const void* imImageGetAttribute(const imImage* image, const char* attrib, int *data_type, int *count);
00200 
00201 /** Returns a list of the attribute names. \n
00202  * "attrib" must contain room enough for "attrib_count" names. Use "attrib=NULL" to return only the count.
00203  *
00204  * \verbatim image:GetAttributeList() -> data: table of strings [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00205  * \ingroup imgclass */
00206 void imImageGetAttributeList(const imImage* image, char** attrib, int *attrib_count);
00207 
00208 /** Sets all image data to zero. But if color space is YCBCR, LAB or LUV, and data type is BYTE or USHORT, then
00209  * data is initialized with 128 or 32768 accordingly. Alpha is initialized as transparent (0).
00210  *
00211  * \verbatim image:Clear() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00212  * \ingroup imgclass */
00213 void imImageClear(imImage* image);
00214 
00215 /** Indicates that the image can be viewed in common graphic devices.     
00216  * Data type must be IM_BYTE. Color mode can be IM_RGB, IM_MAP, IM_GRAY or IM_BINARY.
00217  *
00218  * \verbatim image:IsBitmap() -> is_bitmap: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00219  * \ingroup imgclass */
00220 int imImageIsBitmap(const imImage* image);
00221 
00222 /** Changes the image palette.
00223  * This will destroy the existing palette and replace it with the given palette pointer.
00224  * Only the pointer is stored, so the palette should be a new palette and it can not be a static array.
00225  *
00226  * \verbatim image:SetPalette(palette: imPalette) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00227  * \ingroup imgclass */
00228 void imImageSetPalette(imImage* image, long* palette, int palette_count);
00229 
00230 /** Returns 1 if the images match width and height. Returns 0 otherwise.
00231  *
00232  * \verbatim image:MatchSize(image2: imImage) -> match: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00233  * \ingroup imgclass */
00234 int imImageMatchSize(const imImage* image1, const imImage* image2);
00235 
00236 /** Returns 1 if the images match color mode and data type. Returns 0 otherwise.
00237  *
00238  * \verbatim image:MatchColor(image2: imImage) -> match: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00239  * \ingroup imgclass */
00240 int imImageMatchColor(const imImage* image1, const imImage* image2);
00241 
00242 /** Returns 1 if the images match width, height and data type. Returns 0 otherwise.
00243  *
00244  * \verbatim image:MatchDataType(image2: imImage) -> match: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00245  * \ingroup imgclass */
00246 int imImageMatchDataType(const imImage* image1, const imImage* image2);
00247 
00248 /** Returns 1 if the images match width, height and color space. Returns 0 otherwise.
00249  *
00250  * \verbatim image:MatchColorSpace(image2: imImage) -> match: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00251  * \ingroup imgclass */
00252 int imImageMatchColorSpace(const imImage* image1, const imImage* image2);
00253 
00254 /** Returns 1 if the images match in width, height, data type and color space. Returns 0 otherwise.
00255  *
00256  * \verbatim image:Match(image2: imImage) -> match: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00257  * \ingroup imgclass */
00258 int imImageMatch(const imImage* image1, const imImage* image2);

00260 /** Changes the image color space to map
00261  * by just changing color_space. \n
00262  * Image must be BINARY or GRAY/BYTE.
00263  *
00264  * \verbatim image:SetMap() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00265  * \ingroup imgclass */
00266 void imImageSetMap(imImage* image);
00267 
00268 /** Changes the image color space to binary 
00269  * by just changing color_space and the palette.
00270  * Image must be MAP or GRAY/BYTE.
00271  *
00272  * \verbatim image:SetBinary() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00273  * \ingroup imgclass */
00274 void imImageSetBinary(imImage* image);
00275 
00276 /** Changes the image color space to gray
00277  * by just changing color_space and the palette.
00278  * Image must be BINARY or MAP. Palette is changed only if image was BINARY.
00279  *
00280  * \verbatim image:SetGray() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00281  * \ingroup imgclass */
00282 void imImageSetGray(imImage* image);
00283 
00284 /** Changes a gray BYTE data (0,255) into a binary data (0,1), done in-place. 
00285  * Color space is not changed. Data type must be IM_BYTE.
00286  *
00287  * \verbatim image:MakeBinary() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00288  * \ingroup imgclass */
00289 void imImageMakeBinary(imImage *image);
00290 
00291 /** Changes a binary data (0,1) into a gray BYTE data (0,255), done in-place. 
00292  * Color space is not changed. Data type must be IM_BYTE.
00293  *
00294  * \verbatim image:MakeGray() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00295  * \ingroup imgclass */
00296 void imImageMakeGray(imImage *image);

00300 /** \defgroup imgfile imImage Storage
00301  *
00302  * \par
00303  *  Functions to simplify the process of reading and writting imImage structures. 
00304  *  Will also load and save the alpha planes when possible.
00305  * \par
00306  * See \ref im_image.h
00307  * \ingroup file */
00308 
00309 
00310 /** Loads an image from an already open file. Returns NULL if failed. \n
00311  * This will call \ref imFileReadImageInfo and \ref imFileReadImageData. \n
00312  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00313  * The returned image will be of the same color_space and data_type of the image in the file. \n
00314  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00315  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00316  *
00317  * \verbatim ifile:LoadImage([index: number]) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00318  * Default index is 0.
00319  * \ingroup imgfile */
00320 imImage* imFileLoadImage(imFile* ifile, int index, int *error);
00321 
00322 /** Loads an image from an already open file. Returns NULL if failed. \n
00323  * This function assumes that the image in the file has the same parameters as the given image. \n
00324  * This will call \ref imFileReadImageInfo and \ref imFileReadImageData. \n
00325  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00326  * The returned image will be of the same color_space and data_type of the image in the file. \n
00327  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00328  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00329  *
00330  * \verbatim ifile:LoadImageFrame(index: number, image: imImage) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00331  * Default index is 0.
00332  * \ingroup imgfile */
00333 void imFileLoadImageFrame(imFile* ifile, int index, imImage* image, int *error);
00334 
00335 /** Loads an image from an already open file, but forces the image to be a bitmap.\n
00336  * The returned imagem will be always a Bitmap image, with color_space RGB, MAP, GRAY or BINARY, and data_type IM_BYTE. \n
00337  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00338  * Returns NULL if failed.
00339  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00340  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00341  *
00342  * \verbatim ifile:LoadBitmap([index: number]) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00343  * Default index is 0.
00344  * \ingroup imgfile */
00345 imImage* imFileLoadBitmap(imFile* ifile, int index, int *error);
00346 
00347 /** Loads an image region from an already open file. Returns NULL if failed. \n
00348  * This will call \ref imFileReadImageInfo and \ref imFileReadImageData. \n
00349  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00350  * The returned image will be of the same color_space and data_type of the image in the file, 
00351  * or will be a Bitmap image. \n
00352  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00353  * See also \ref imErrorCodes. \n
00354  * For now, it works only for the ECW file format.
00355  *
00356  * \verbatim ifile:LoadRegion(index, bitmap, xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, width, height: number) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00357  * Default index is 0.
00358  * \ingroup imgfile */
00359 imImage* imFileLoadImageRegion(imFile* ifile, int index, int bitmap, int *error, 
00360                                int xmin, int xmax, int ymin, int ymax, int width, int height);
00361 
00362 /** Loads an image from an already open file, but forces the image to be a bitmap.\n
00363  * This function assumes that the image in the file has the same parameters as the given image. \n
00364  * The imagem must be a Bitmap image, with color_space RGB, MAP, GRAY or BINARY, and data_type IM_BYTE. \n
00365  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00366  * Returns NULL if failed.
00367  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00368  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00369  *
00370  * \verbatim ifile:LoadBitmapFrame(index: number, image: imImage) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00371  * Default index is 0.
00372  * \ingroup imgfile */
00373 void imFileLoadBitmapFrame(imFile* ifile, int index, imImage* image, int *error);
00374 
00375 /** Saves the image to an already open file. \n
00376  * This will call \ref imFileWriteImageInfo and \ref imFileWriteImageData. \n
00377  * Attributes from the image will be stored at the file.
00378  * Returns error code.
00379  *
00380  * \verbatim ifile:SaveImage(image: imImage) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00381  * \ingroup imgfile */
00382 int imFileSaveImage(imFile* ifile, const imImage* image);
00383 
00384 /** Loads an image from file. Open, loads and closes the file. \n
00385  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00386  * Returns NULL if failed.
00387  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00388  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00389  *
00390  * \verbatim im.FileImageLoad(file_name: string, [index: number]) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00391  * Default index is 0.
00392  * \ingroup imgfile */
00393 imImage* imFileImageLoad(const char* file_name, int index, int *error);
00394 
00395 /** Loads an image from file, but forces the image to be a bitmap. Open, loads and closes the file. \n
00396  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00397  * Returns NULL if failed.
00398  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00399  * See also \ref imErrorCodes.
00400  *
00401  * \verbatim im.FileImageLoadBitmap(file_name: string, [index: number]) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00402  * Default index is 0.
00403  * \ingroup imgfile */
00404 imImage* imFileImageLoadBitmap(const char* file_name, int index, int *error);
00405 
00406 /** Loads an image region from file. Open, loads and closes the file. \n
00407  * index specifies the image number between 0 and image_count-1. \n
00408  * Returns NULL if failed.
00409  * Attributes from the file will be stored at the image.
00410  * See also \ref imErrorCodes. \n
00411  * For now, it works only for the ECW file format.
00412  *
00413  * \verbatim im.FileImageLoadRegion(file_name: string, index, bitmap, xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, width, height: number, ) -> image: imImage, error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00414  * Default index is 0.
00415  * \ingroup imgfile */
00416 imImage* imFileImageLoadRegion(const char* file_name, int index, int bitmap, int *error, 
00417                                int xmin, int xmax, int ymin, int ymax, int width, int height);
00418 
00419 /** Saves the image to file. Open, saves and closes the file. \n
00420  * Returns error code. \n
00421  * Attributes from the image will be stored at the file.
00422  *
00423  * \verbatim im.FileImageSave(file_name: string, format: string, image: imImage) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00424  * \verbatim image:Save(file_name: string, format: string) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00425  * \ingroup imgfile */
00426 int imFileImageSave(const char* file_name, const char* format, const imImage* image);

00430 /** Utility macro to draw the image in a CD library canvas.
00431  * Works only for data_type IM_BYTE, and color spaces: IM_RGB, IM_MAP, IMGRAY and IM_BINARY.
00432  * \ingroup imgclass */
00433 #define imcdCanvasPutImage(_canvas, _image, _x, _y, _w, _h, _xmin, _xmax, _ymin, _ymax)     \
00434   {                                                                         \
00435     if (_image->color_space == IM_RGB)                                      \
00436     {                                                                       \
00437       if (_image->has_alpha)                                                \
00438         cdCanvasPutImageRectRGBA(_canvas, _image->width, _image->height,    \
00439                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[0],                  \
00440                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[1],                  \
00441                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[2],                  \
00442                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[3],                  \
00443                           _x, _y, _w, _h, _xmin, _xmax, _ymin, _ymax);      \
00444       else                                                                  \
00445         cdCanvasPutImageRectRGB(_canvas, _image->width, _image->height,     \
00446                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[0],                  \
00447                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[1],                  \
00448                           (unsigned char*)_image->data[2],                  \
00449                           _x, _y, _w, _h, _xmin, _xmax, _ymin, _ymax);      \
00450     }                                                                       \
00451     else                                                                    \
00452       cdCanvasPutImageRectMap(_canvas, _image->width, _image->height,       \
00453                         (unsigned char*)_image->data[0], _image->palette,   \
00454                         _x, _y, _w, _h, _xmin, _xmax, _ymin, _ymax);        \
00455   }                                                                               
00456
